        public static void addEdgeNode(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
               org.w3c.dom.Node rootNode,
               java.lang.String sourceNode,
               java.lang.String dstNode,
               java.lang.String edgeValue)
        Adds a new edge node to the specified document. Edge conforms to Groove input format: """ @param edgeValue """
        Parameters:
        doc -
        rootNode -
        sourceNode -
        dstNode -
        edgeValue -

      • addNode

        public static org.w3c.dom.Node addNode(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                       org.w3c.dom.Node parentNode,
                       java.lang.String nodeId)
        Adds a node to the Document doc under the node parentNode as per the groove input xml format.
        Parameters:
        doc - - the Document we are working with.
        nodeId - - a string identifier for the node.
        parentNode - - the parent to append this under, may be of type Document or Element
        Returns:
        the node that was created.

      • addTag

        public static org.w3c.dom.Node addTag(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                      org.w3c.dom.Node parentNode,
                      java.lang.String tagType)
        Adds a node to the Document doc under the node parentNode as per the groove input xml format.
        Parameters:
        doc - - the Document we are working with.
        parentNode - - the parent to append this under, may be of type Document or Element
        Returns:
        the node that was created.

      • addValueToNode

        public static void addValueToNode(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                  org.w3c.dom.Element parent,
                  org.w3c.dom.Element node,
                  java.lang.String value)
        Adds a new value to an existing node in the document. In the groove input this has the effect of adding an new edge from the node to node with a value on it. In groove this looks like it is an attribute on the node.
        Parameters:
        doc - - document the node belongs to.
        node - - node to add to.
        value - - the string value to put into the node.

      • printXML

        public static void printXML(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
            java.io.File output)
                     throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
        Prints out the XML tree that is held within the doc parameter.
        Parameters:
        doc - - the main document which contains the XML tree
        Throws:
        javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - if the routine is unable to transform the XML tree to a string
